enumeratedValues.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValues.description: Normal operation. MASK* bits within the corresponding submodule are not updated until a FORCE_OUT event occurs within the submodule.

enumeratedValues.name: MASK_IMMEDIATE
enumeratedValues.description: Immediate operation. MASK* bits within the corresponding submodule are updated on the following clock edge after setting this bit.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Do not load new values.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Load prescaler, modulus, and PWM values of the corresponding submodule.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: PWM counter is stopped, but PWM outputs will hold the current state.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: PWM counter is started in the corresponding submodule.

enumeratedValues.name: PWM23
enumeratedValues.description: PWM23 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule.

enumeratedValues.name: PWM45
enumeratedValues.description: PWM45 is used to generate complementary PWM pair in the corresponding submodule.

enumeratedValues.name: NOTLOCKED_DO_NOT_MON_PLL
enumeratedValues.description: Not locked. Do not monitor PLL operation. Resetting of the fractional delay block in case of PLL losing lock will be controlled by software.

enumeratedValues.name: NOTLOCKED_MON_PLL
enumeratedValues.description: Not locked. Monitor PLL operation to automatically disable the fractional delay block when the PLL encounters problems.

enumeratedValues.name: LOCKED_DO_NOT_MON_PLL
enumeratedValues.description: Locked. Do not monitor PLL operation. Resetting of the fractional delay block in case of PLL losing lock will be controlled by software. These bits are write protected until the next reset.

enumeratedValues.name: LOCKED_MON_PLL
enumeratedValues.description: Locked. Monitor PLL operation to automatically disable the fractional delay block when the PLL encounters problems. These bits are write protected until the next reset.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: FAULTx CPU interrupt requests disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: FAULTx CPU interrupt requests enabled.

enumeratedValues.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValues.description: Normal mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFPINx]. If neither FHALF nor FFULL is set then the fault condition cannot be cleared. The PWM outputs disabled by this fault input will not be re-enabled until the actual FAULTx input signal de-asserts since the fault input will combinationally disable the PWM outputs (as programmed in DISMAPn).

enumeratedValues.name: SAFE
enumeratedValues.description: Safe mode. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear and FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL]. If neither FHLAF nor FFULL is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared.

enumeratedValues.name: MANUAL
enumeratedValues.description: Manual fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are not enabled until FSTS[FFLAGx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL]. If neither FFULL nor FHALF is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared. This is further controlled by FCTRL[FSAFE].

enumeratedValues.name: AUTOMATIC
enumeratedValues.description: Automatic fault clearing. PWM outputs disabled by this fault are enabled when FSTS[FFPINx] is clear at the start of a half cycle or full cycle depending on the states of FSTS[FHALF] and FSTS[FFULL] without regard to the state of FSTS[FFLAGx]. If neither FFULL nor FHALF is set, then the fault condition cannot be cleared.

enumeratedValues.name: LOGIC_0
enumeratedValues.description: A logic 0 on the fault input indicates a fault condition.

enumeratedValues.name: LOGIC_1
enumeratedValues.description: A logic 1 on the fault input indicates a fault condition.

enumeratedValues.name: NO_FLAG
enumeratedValues.description: No fault on the FAULTx pin.

enumeratedValues.name: FLAG
enumeratedValues.description: Fault on the FAULTx pin.

enumeratedValues.name: PWM_OUTPUTS_NOT_REENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a full cycle

enumeratedValues.name: PWM_OUTPUTS_REENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a full cycle

enumeratedValues.name: PWM_OUTPUTS_NOT_REENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: PWM outputs are not re-enabled at the start of a half cycle.

enumeratedValues.name: PWM_OUTPUTS_REENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: PWM outputs are re-enabled at the start of a half cycle (as defined by VAL0).

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Fault input glitch stretching is disabled.

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: Input fault signals will be stretched to at least 2 IPBus clock cycles.

enumeratedValues.name: NO_FAULT
enumeratedValues.description: No fault

enumeratedValues.name: FAULT
enumeratedValues.description: Cause a simulated fault

fields.name: NOCOMB
fields.description: No Combinational Path From Fault Input To PWM Output

enumeratedValues.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValues.description: There is a combinational link from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs. The fault inputs are combined with the filtered and latched fault signals to disable the PWM outputs.

enumeratedValues.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValues.description: The direct combinational path from the fault inputs to the PWM outputs is disabled and the filtered and latched fault signals are used to disable the PWM outputs.
